sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The maxcolor function is used to determine the maximum color number for the current mode of the screen. The alternate spelling is maxcolour.
sections.text_content: The maxcolor function is used to determine the maximum color number for the current mode of the screen. The alternate spelling is maxcolour.
sections.mdown_content: The **maxcolor** function is used to determine the maximum color number for the current mode of the screen. The alternate spelling is **maxcolour**.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "screen" mode. See setscreen for details.

For IBM PC compatibles in "screen" mode, maxcolor = 15. For the default IBM PC compatible "graphics" mode (CGA), maxcolor = 3.
